question: On the 14th of April this year the RMS Titanic collides with an iceberg and sinks; killing around 1500 people.
Julius Ceasar becomes emperor of the Roman Republic.
FIFA, The 'Fédération Internationale de Football Association' is formed.
Ghengis Khan, founder of the Mongol empire dies.
Constantinople falls to the Ottoman Empire, marking the end of the Roman Empire.
The Treaty of Versailles is signed.
The Kyoto Protocol was adopted in Kyoto, Japan, on 11 December of this year. Some 7 years later it entered into effect.
Non-avian dinosaurs go extinct after a rock at least 10 km in diameter slams into the Earth.
The oldest fossils of Homo Sapiens Sapiens are approximately this old.
Star Wars: A New Hope is released.
The United States of America puts a man on The Moon.
The U.S drops an atomic bomb on Hiroshima. Between 90 and 120 thousand people die.
Taylor Swift is born.
ARPANET, precursor to the Internet is established in the U.S.
South Sudan gains independence from North Sudan.
Segregation was abolished by the Civil Rights Act in the U.S. this year.
Blacks are allowed to vote in South Africa, finally ending Apartheid.
The Shang dynasty, longest lasting of the Chinese dynasties ends.
The Great Pyramid of Giza is finished during the 4th Egyptian dynasty.
The second Punic war break out.
Women gain the right to vote in New Zealand.
The Bastille is stormed in Paris. The French Revolution had begun.
Bolsheviks gain power in Russia.
The American Revolution concludes with the foundation of The United States of America.
Scottish biologist Sir Alexander Fleming identifies 'Penicillium notatum' and starts distribution of the mould.
The Mona Lisa is painted.
The 30 year war, one of the most destructive conflicts in European history breaks out.
Nicolaus Copernicus proposes that Earth revolves around Sun.
Leo Tolstoy's 'War and Peace' is published in its entirety.
The first pope is elected.
William Shakespeare dies.
The Dalai Lama goes into exile in India.
The Panama Canal is completed.
Stonehenge is constructed.
Amelia Earhart disappears.
Aristotle is born.
The Berlin Wall falls.
The Siege of Alexandria takes place. The library burns.
The first transatlantic wireless communication is established.
Superman makes his first appearance.
Nikola Tesla is born in Smiljan, Austrian Empire (now Croatia).
U2 is formed in Dublin, Ireland
Albert Einstein dies.
J. J. Thomson discovers the electron.
Doom, a seminal first person shooter video game, is released by id Software.
Edward Snowden releases classified documents proving that NSA does warrantless wiretapping.
Julian Assange and others establish WikiLeaks.
The Beatles release 'Abbey Road'.
The League of Nations is founded following the Paris Peace Conference.
The United Nations is formed.
The Non-Profileration treaty of Nuclear Weapons enters into force.
Harry Potter and The Philosopher's Stone is released in the U.K.
The Lord of the Rings is published.
The Epic poem of Gilgamesh dates from this approximate time.
The Rosetta Stone is discovered.
The tomb of king Tutankhamun is discovered.
The Illiad and Odessey by Homer is written down.
The Trojan War ends with the destruction of Troy.
The Second World War breaks out when Germany invades Poland.
Sir Isaac Newton is born.
Muhammad Ali knocks out Sonny Liston in the first round of their second match.
Fernão de Magalhães (Magellan) returns to Spain; making him the first to circumnavigate the Earth.
Vasco da Gama becomes the first European to reach India by sea.
Columbus reaches the new world by stepping ashore on an island in the Bahamas archipelago that he named 'San Salvador'.
Roald Amundsen leads the first expedition to successfully traverse Canada's Northwest Passage between the Atlantic and Pacific oceans.
Martin Luther attacks the church in his piece 'The Ninety-Five Theses'.
The first successful implantation of an artificial heart is performed.
Dolly the sheep is the first mammal to be cloned from an adult somatic cell.
Batman makes his first appearance in comics.
NATO - North Atlantic Treaty Organization, is formed.
Ian Flemming publishes Casino Royale.
The Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in the town of Pripyat in Ukraine explodes.
Barack Obama becomes president in the United States.
Jules Verne publishes 'Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea'.
Fyodor Dostoyevsky publishes 'Crime and Punishment'.
Steamboat Willie is released.
Monty Python's Flying Circus premiers on BBC.
